Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a pale-red pottery wine-jar, the fabric contains a large number of small white inclusions, the interior is slightly grooved and spotted with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a cream-coloured slip and remains of two lines of black-painted hieratic text recording the contents as wine of year 2 from the western Delta river branch.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393455) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393455)
